naming_conventions.mixed: Some folders with no strict convention

file_type_patterns..sh: Shell scripts in scripts/ and hooks/

organization_patterns.subdirectory_categorization: Most folders organize files into subdirectories
organization_patterns.archive_pattern: Historical files in archive/ subdirectories with date-based organization

creation_patterns.automated: Many files created by slash commands (/clean, /dev)
creation_patterns.manual: Some folders contain manually maintained content
creation_patterns.auto_generated: Scripts and tools generate files programmatically

git_analysis_summary.recent_activity: Last 30 days show active development across all analyzed folders

summary.message: Analyzed 68 folders, generated 68 INDEX.md files, created 61 new README.md files, updated 4 stale README.md files, confirmed 3 fresh README.md files. All folders now have complete documentation of their organization rules and patterns.
next_steps: Cleanliness-inspector can now use these README files for folder-specific rules
Style-inspector can validate compliance with discovered naming conventions
Archive folders are clearly marked with non-modification rules
